org.eng.aisp.feature.extractor.vector

Class MFFBFeatureExtractor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eng.aisp.processor.GenericCachingDataProcessor
      • org.eng.aisp.processor.AbstractCachingWindowProcessor<IDataWindow<double[]>,IFeature<double[]>>
        • org.eng.aisp.feature.extractor.vector.MFFBFeatureExtractor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, IDoubleFeatureExtractor, IFeatureExtractor<double[],double[]>, IWindowProcessor<IDataWindow<double[]>,IFeature<double[]>>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LogMelFeatureExtractor

    public class MFFBFeatureExtractor
extends AbstractCachingWindowProcessor<IDataWindow<double[]>,IFeature<double[]>>
implements IDoubleFeatureExtractor
    Mel-frequency filter bank (MFFB) feature extractor. Beyond the number of bands in the resulting MFFB, configuration is available to allow restricting to a frequency range, normalization (scaling), taking the log of the MFFB coefficients and sizing the output feature.
    Author:
    wangshiq
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • MFFBFeatureExtractor

        public MFFBFeatureExtractor(double targetSamplingRate,
                            int numBands,
                            int minFreq,
                            int maxFreq,
                            boolean normalize,
                            boolean useLog)
        A convenience on MFFBFeatureExtractor(double, int, int, int, boolean, boolean, int) that does not alter the feature length (i.e. sets maxFinalCoefs=0).

      • MFFBFeatureExtractor

        public MFFBFeatureExtractor(double targetSamplingRate,
                            int numBands,
                            int minFreq,
                            int maxFreq,
                            boolean normalize,
                            boolean useLog,
                            int maxFinalCoefs)
        Constructor for Mel-frequency filter bank feature extractor. The feature can be restricted to a number of features within a given frequency range.
        Parameters:
        numBands - defines the number of bands used in the Triangle filter. THe base feature produced covers the frequency range with this number of values. The feature length ultimately produces can be further controlled by minFinalCoefs parameter.
        minFreq - the minimum frequency present in the output feature.
        maxFreq - the maximum frequency present in the output feature.
        normalize - Specifies whether normalization is applied to the output of triangle filter. Normalization involves scaling each feature value such that the sum of all features equals 1.
        useLog - Specifies whether log is applied to the output of triangle filter and normalization (if enabled)
        maxFinalCoefs - may be use to truncate the base feature vector computed using numBands. if 0, then the feature length is the number of bands. If larger than 0, then the feature vector will be padded as necessary to the given length.

      • MFFBFeatureExtractor

        public MFFBFeatureExtractor(int numBands,

    • Method Detail

      • applyImpl

        protected IFeature<double[]> applyImpl(IDataWindow<double[]> window)
        Description copied from class: AbstractCachingWindowProcessor
        The actual implementation of the processing. This is only called when the result was not found in the cache. The return value will be cached for later use.
        Specified by:
        applyImpl in class AbstractCachingWindowProcessor<IDataWindow<double[]>,IFeature<double[]>>
        Returns:
        null can be returned, but it will not be cached.

      • computeMFFB

        protected static Signal2D computeMFFB(IDataWindow<double[]> recording,
                                      double targetSamplingRate,
                                      int numBands,
                                      int minFreq,
                                      int maxFreq,
                                      boolean normalize,
                                      boolean useLog,
                                      double maxPeakToNoiseRation)
                               throws IllegalArgumentException
        Compute the LogMel. Broken out so we can share code with MFCCFeatureExtractor.
        Parameters:
        recording -
        targetSamplingRate -
        numBands -
        minFreq -
        maxFreq -
        normalize - by setting the sum of all coefficients to 1.
        useLog - take the log10 of all coeffecients.
        Returns:
        nver null
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException

      • buildFeature

        public static IFeature<double[]> buildFeature(IDataWindow<double[]> recording,
                                              Signal2D feature,
                                              int maxLength)
        Create a feature of from the given vector of doubles.
        Parameters:
        recording -
        featureData -
        maxLength - if larger than 0, then specifies the length of the data array in the returned feature. If less than the given feature vector length, then pad with 0s.
        Returns:
        a feature with the start/stop times from the givne window and data set from the given feature vector.
